feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 6:18AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snow Tonight and Friday... Snow is expected to spread over the Eastern North Slope late tonight and continue through Friday night. Between 4 and 6 inches of snow is expected above 2000 feet over the Brooks Range from Anaktuvuk Pass east. Below 2000 feet 2 to 4 inches of snow is expected. This could make travel difficult over Atigun Pass from

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 1:47PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gulkana River Rises Expected... Renewed river rises are expected on the Gulkana River through the next few days based on runoff from recent precipitation. River levels will be near bankfull and some flooding of low areas and rural roads near the river will be possible, as water routes through the system.

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Mariposa County. .High mountain snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 12:09PM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Utah... Duchesne River near Randlett affecting Uintah County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river and stream flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt will continue.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 10:30AM MDT until June 02 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... Logan River Near Logan affecting Cache County. Minor flooding is forecast to return to the Logan River near Logan beginning as early as Tuesday. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 11:54AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON... entry.title: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 11:05AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton Wyoming continues the Flood Warning for the following river in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .Mountain snowmelt continues as cooler weather arrives to end the week. This will slow mountain snowmelt above 8,000 feet, decreasing flows on tributaries feeding the Bear River. Rain showers are

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 10:56AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton continues a Flood Advisory for the following river in Wyoming... Salt River near Etna affecting Lincoln County. .Mountain snowmelt continues as cooler weather arrives to end the week. While this slows the snowmelt, rain showers are expected into the weekend. entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 10:49AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following river in Wyoming... Pacific Creek near Moran affecting Teton County. .Mountain snowmelt continues as cooler weather arrives to end the week. While this slows the snowmelt, rain showers are expected into the weekend. Overall, water levels on Pacific Creek will show little change through the weekend.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 01 at 3:33AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: .Slow moving thunderstorms and training thunderstorms will create the potential for flash flooding conditions across the forecast area the next couple of days. Recent heavy rainfall has saturated some of the soils across the region. Additional heavy rainfall is expected, with the potential for 1-2 inches of rainfall daily for some areas. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE
